EmpiNull 1.0.0

Estimate Empirical Null Parameters for the Poisson Exact Models

empirical_null_ind_pois.Rd

Estimate Empirical Null Parameters for the Poisson Exact Models

Usage

empirical_null_ind_pois(
  Z,
  Xbar,
  E,
  E2,
  p_grid = seq(0.8, 0.99, 0.005),
  cutoff = 0.95
)

Arguments

Z

A numeric vector of observed Z-scores.

Xbar

A numeric matrix (n_clusters × p) of cluster means.

E

A numeric vector, where \(E_i = \sum_j \exp(X_{ij}^T \beta)\).

E2

A numeric vector, where \(E_i^{(2)} = \sum_j \exp(X_{ij}^T \beta)^2\).

p_grid

A numeric vector of candidate p0 values to search over (default: seq(0.8, 0.99, 0.005)).

cutoff

Quantile cutoff for initializing truncation bounds in init_trunc_pois (default = 0.95).

init

Optional initial parameter vector [ zeta (length p), sigmaAlpha2, sigmaEps2 ]. If NULL, the function calls init_trunc_pois() to construct one.

Value

A named list with elements:

p0

Estimated null proportion.

negloglik

Minimum negative log-likelihood.

zeta01..zeta_p

Estimated regression coefficients.

sigmaAlpha2

Estimated variance component \(\sigma_\alpha^2\).

sigmaEps2

Estimated variance component \(\sigma_\epsilon^2\).
